document.masterDocTitle: A catalogue of the Scathophagidae (Diptera) of the Palaearctic region, with notes on their taxonomy and faunistics

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A catalogue of the Scathophagidae (Diptera) of the Palaearctic region, with notes on their taxonomy and faunistics

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cordylura spinimana Fallén, 1819: 7
. SYNTYPES : J ♀ , Sweden , ‘Habitat passim in Scania [= lives across Skåne ]’ (probably MZLU).

Musca semiflava Panzer,1798:19
. HOLOTYPE : The figure shows a ♀ , type locality not given (depository unknown). Synonymized independently by
SCHINER (1864b: 78)
and
NEUHAUS (1866: 241)
.

Cordylura armipes Meigen, 1826: 234
.? HOLOTYPE : J, type locality not given; there is one male specimen (No. 2142) in Meigen’s collection ( MNHN ) (L. Matile, pers. comm.). Synonymized by
ŠIFNER (1995b: 115)
.

Cordylura flavicauda Meigen, 1826: 235
. HOLOTYPE : J, ‘Nur das Männchen [= only male]’, type locality not given (depository unknown). Synonymized by
BECKER (1894: 127)
.

Cordylura ruficauda Zetterstedt, 1838: 733
. HOLOTYPE : J, Norway , ‘Hab. in Dowre [= Dovre], Boheman leg.’ (probably MZLU). Synonymized by
SACK (1937: 67)
.

Cordylura flava von Roser, 1840: 59
. HOLOTYPE . J,?Württemberg [in Germany ] (depository unknown). Synonymized by
BECKER (1905: 13)
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Cordylura zetterstedti Gimmerthal, 1846
[also in GIMMERTHAL (1847: 190) ]. HOLOTYPE : ♀ , ‘Kurland’ [currently in Latvia ]. The type material was destroyed during World War II in St. Petersburg , Russia (†A.A. Stackelberg, pers. comm.). Synonymized by ŠIFNER (1995: 115).

Note. Both descriptions of
C. zetterstedti
( GIMMERTHAL 1846 , 1847 ) are identical (cf. ŠIFNER 1995b: 115 ). SÉGUY (1952: 18) interpreted
C. zetterstedti Gimmerthal, 1846
, as
Norellisoma zetterstedti
; BECKER (1905: 3) and SÉGUY (1952: 38) treated
C. zetterstedti Gimmerthal, 1847
, as
Cordylura zetterstedti
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Norellia roserii Rondani, 1867: 101
. HOLOTYPE : J, Germany , ‘specimen germanicum [= German specimen]’ (depository unknown). Synonymized by
BECKER (1905: 13)
.

Norellia occidentalis Malloch, 1919a: 311
. HOLOTYPE : ♀ , USA , Oregon , Corvalis, 2.v.1915 , No.541,A. L. Lorett leg. (CNC). Synonymized by
VOCKEROTH (1965: 827)
.

Norellisoma septentrionalis Hendel, 1930b: 2
. HOLOTYPE : J, Russia , ‘ Kamtschatka [= Kamchatka ], Petropavlovsk, 9.vii. [19]22’ (NHRS). Synonymized by
VOCKEROTH (1965: 827)
.
